location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.1176 of 1857 from Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay, to Commander Felix Jones, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter is a covering letter, enclosing an extract of paragraph 11 of despatch no.8 of 1857 (folio 296) from the Court of Directors, dated 14 January 1856, relating to the capture by the British authorities of a vessel under Turkish colours carrying twelve slaves. The extract notes that, though the slaves have been freed, the existing treaties ‘did not warrant the condemnation of the captured Bugla [vessel]’, so that Jones had no option but to hand the vessel over to the Turkish authorities.
